revised_title: The Complex Apparatus Architecture and Function of Promissum Pulchrum
tldr: The author analyzes over 100 complete apparatuses of the conodont Promissum pulchrum, found in the Soom Shale Member, South Africa. They reconstruct the three-dimensional architecture of the apparatus, which has 19 elements, and propose a functional interpretation of how it operated as an integrated set of mouthparts. This discovery provides a template for understanding other conodont taxa and contributes to the study of vertebrate evolution.
